member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgGdi.IGraphics
member.summary:
An interface that contains exactly the same methods as the GDI+ Graphics object. If your drawing routines draw to an IGraphics interface, then you can supply either a GdiGraphics object to render to the screen, or an object to render to an SVG file.
It's a pity that Graphics is a sealed class. Otherwise there'd be no need to have this interface or the class; we could simply derive a class from Graphics to do SVG output.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgGdi.GdiGraphics
member.summary: An IGraphics implementation that simply passes every call through to a GDI+ Graphics object.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGdiNotImpl
member.summary: Exception thrown when a GDI+ operation is attempted on an IGraphics implementor that does not support the operation. For instance, SvgGraphics does not support any of the MeasureString methods.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.MetafileTools.EmfTools.BinaryReaderExtensions.Skip(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Int32)
member.summary: Skips excess bytes. Work-around for some WMF files that contain undocumented fields.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgGdi.MetafileTools.EmfTools.EmfBinaryRecord.RecordType
member.summary: Gets or sets record type (aka RecordFunction)

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.MetafileTools.EmfTools.EmfBinaryRecord.Read(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads a record from binary stream. If this method is not overridden it will skip this record and go to next record. NOTE: When overriding this method remove the base.Read(reader) line from code.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics
member.summary:
This is an IGraphics implementor that builds up an SVG scene. Use it like a regular Graphics object, and call WriteXMLString to output SVG. In this way, whatever you would normally draw becomes available as an SVG document.
SvgGraphics has to do quite a lot of work to convert GDI instructions to SVG equivalents. Some things are approximated and slight differences will be noticed. Also, in several places GDI+ does not do what it is supposed to (e.g. arcs of non-circular ellipses, truncating bitmaps). In these cases SvgGraphics does do the right thing, so the result will be different.
Some GDI instructions such as MeasureString are meaningless in SVG, usually because there is no physical display device to refer to. When such a method is called an exception is thrown.
Many parameters used by GDI have no SVG equivalent -- for instance, GDI allows some fine control over how font hints are used. This detailed information is thrown away.
Some aspects of GDI that can be implemented in SVG are not. The most important omission is that only solid brushes are supported.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.CompositingMode
member.summary: Get is not implemented (throws an exception). Set does nothing.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.CompositingQuality
member.summary: Get is not implemented (throws an exception). Set does nothing.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Get is not implemented (throws an exception). Set does nothing.

member.summary: Get is not implemented (throws an exception). Set does nothing.

member.summary: Get is not implemented (throws an exception). Set does nothing.

member.summary: Get is not implemented (throws an exception). Set does nothing.

member.summary: Get is not implemented (throws an exception). Set does nothing.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.TextContrast

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.AddMetafileComment(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Does nothing. Should perhaps insert a comment into the SVG XML output, but is this really analogous to a metafile comment.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.BeginContainer
member.summary: Implemented, but returns null as SVG has a proper scenegraph, unlike GDI+. The effect of calling BeginContainer is to create a new SVG group and apply transformations etc to produce the effect that a GDI+ container would produce.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawArc(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Implemented. DrawArc functions work correctly and thus produce different output from GDI+ if the ellipse is not circular.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawClosedCurve(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.PointF[])
member.summary: Implemented. The DrawClosedCurve functions emulate GDI behavior by drawing a coaligned cubic bezier. This seems to produce a very good approximation so probably GDI+ does the same thing -- a

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawCurve(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.PointF[])
member.summary: Implemented. The DrawCurve functions emulate GDI behavior by drawing a coaligned cubic bezier. This seems to produce a very good approximation so probably GDI+ does the same.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawIcon(System.Drawing.Icon,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Implemented. The DrawIcon group of functions emulate drawing a bitmap by creating many SVG rect elements. This is quite effective but can lead to a very big SVG file. Alpha and stretching are handled correctly. No antialiasing is done.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawImage(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary:
Implemented. The DrawImage group of functions emulate drawing a bitmap by creating many SVG rect elements. This is quite effective but can lead to a very big SVG file. Alpha and stretching are handled correctly. No antialiasing is done.
The GDI+ documentation suggests that the 'Unscaled' functions should truncate the image. GDI+ does not actually do this, but SvgGraphics does.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawImageUnscaled(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Implemented. There seems to be a GDI bug in that the image is *not* clipped to the rectangle. We do clip it.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawPath(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath)
member.remarks: Mainly based on the libgdi+ implementation: https://github.com/mono/libgdiplus/blob/master/src/graphics-cairo.c and this SO question reply: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1790862/how-to-determine-endpoints-of-arcs-in-graphicspath-pathpoints-and-pathtypes-arra from SiliconMind.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawPie(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Implemented. DrawPie functions work correctly and thus produce different output from GDI+ if the ellipse is not circular.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.DrawString(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Brush,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary:
Implemented.
In general, DrawString functions work, but it is impossible to guarantee that an SVG renderer will have a certain font and draw it in the same way as GDI+.
SVG does not do word wrapping and SvgGdi does not emulate it yet (although clipping is working). The plan is to wait till SVG 1.2 becomes available, since 1.2 contains text wrapping/flowing attributes.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.EndContainer(System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsContainer)
member.summary: The effect of calling this method is to pop out of the closest SVG group. This simulates restoring GDI+ state from a GraphicsContainer

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.WriteSVGString
member.summary: Get a string containing an SVG document. The very heart of SvgGdi. It calls WriteSVGString on the at the root of this SvgGraphics and returns the resulting string.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.IsEndAnchorSimple(System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LineCap)
member.summary: Decides whether the pen's anchor type is simple enough to be drawn by a fast approximation using the DrawEndAnchor

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.HandleBrush(System.Drawing.Brush)
member.summary:
When a GDI instruction with a brush parameter is called, there can be a lot we have to do to emulate the brush. The aim is to return a style that represents the brush.
Solid brush is very easy.
Linear grad brush: we ignore the blend curve and the transformation (and therefore the rotation parameter if any) Hatch brush:
Other types of brushes are too hard to emulate and are rendered pink.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgGdi.SvgGraphics.MatrixStack
member.summary:
This class is needed because GDI+ does not maintain a proper scene graph; rather it maintains a single transformation matrix which is applied to each new object. The matrix is saved and reloaded when 'begincontainer' and 'endcontainer' are called. SvgGraphics has to emulate this behaviour.
This matrix stack caches it's 'result' (ie. the current transformation, the product of all matrices). The result is recalculated when necessary.

member.name: T:SvgNet.IElementWithText
member.summary: Interface for SvgElements that have a text node.

member.name: T:SvgNet.IElementWithXRef
member.summary: Interface for SvgElements that xlink to another element, e.g. use

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElement
member.summary:
The base class for SVG elements. It represents some part of an SVG document, either an element (rect, circle etc) or a text item. Duties include:
Maintains a list of child elements and a list of attributes.
Writes itself and its children to an Xml document.
Reads itself and its children from an Xml document.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgElement.Attributes
member.summary: A hashtable containing this element's attributes. Keys are strings but values can be any type; they will only be reduced to strings when this element needs to convert itself to XML.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgElement.Children
member.summary: An ArrayList containing this element's children

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgElement.Name
member.summary: The name of the XML element that this SVG element represents.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgElement.Parent
member.summary: The element whose child this element is; can be null, because SvgElements may only be inserted into a full SVG tree long after they are created.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgElement.Item(System.String)
member.summary: A quick way to get and set attributes.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgElement.AddChild(SvgNet.SvgElement)
member.summary: Adds a child, and sets the child's parent to this element.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgElement.AddChildren(SvgNet.SvgElement[])
member.summary: Adds a variable number of children

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgElement.ReadXmlElement(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Given a document and a current node, read this element from the node.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgElement.ToString
member.summary: A simple ToString() for use in debugging.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgElement.WriteSVGString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a string that contains a complete SVG document. XML version, DOCTYPE etc are included.
member.param: Should usually be set true. Causes the XML output to be optimized so that long attributes like styles and transformations are represented with entities.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgElement.WriteXmlElements(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Given an XML document and a parent node, write out this node and its descendants as XmlElements.
member.param: A node, or null if this element is to be the root element

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgFactory
member.summary: Static methods to produce/write/copy Svg documents reside in this class.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgFactory.CloneElement(SvgNet.SvgElement)
member.summary: Create a complete deep copy of the given tree of SvgElement objects. A new set of elements is created, and if the attributes are cloneable they are deep-copied too. Since strings and all SvgType classes are cloneable, the new tree is independant of the old.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgFactory.CompressXML(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary:
Helper function to compress long xml attributes into entities.
This would work on any XML, it is not SVG specific, so it should eventually be in some 'xml tools' class.
member.returns: A string of entities which can be inserted into the DOCTYPE when the document is written.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgFactory.LoadFromXML(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Given an xml document and (optionally) a particular element to start from, read the xml nodes and construct a tree of objects. Xml tags that do not correspond to a particular class will be represented by an . This means that literally any XML input can be read in and written out, even if it has nothing to do with Svg. More usefully, it means that new and unsupported tags and attributes will be represented in the SvgElement tree and written out correctly even if SvgNet does not understand them.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgFactory.RecCompXML(System.Collections.Hashtable,System.Collections.Hashtable,System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Int32@)
member.param: Map of attribute to entity name
Output: List of single use attributes to 'uncompress'
Number that is incremented to provide new entity names

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgGroupElement
member.summary: Represents a g element. It has no particular properties of its own.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgSwitchElement
member.summary: Represents a switch element. It has no particular properties of its own.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgClipPathElement
member.summary: Represents a clippath element. It has no particular properties of its own.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgAElement
member.summary: Represents an a element. It has an xref and a target.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgDefsElement
member.summary: Represents a defs element. It has no particular properties of its own.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgGenericElement
member.summary: Represents an element that is not yet represented by a class of its own.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgStopElement
member.summary: Represents an SVG stop element, which specifies one color in a gradient.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgPatternElement
member.summary: Represents an SVG pattern element, which defines a fill pattern by defining a viewport onto a subscene.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgTextElement
member.summary: Represents a text element. The SVG text element is unusual in that it expects actual XML text nodes below it, rather than consisting only of attributes and child elements (other elements like this are title, desc, and tspan). SvgTextElement therefore has to be serialized to XML slightly differently.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgTspanElement
member.summary: Represents a tspan element. The tspan element is unique in that it expects actual XML text nodes below it, rather than consisting only of attributes and child elements. SvgTextElement therefore has to be serialized to XML slightly differently.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgTitleElement
member.summary: Represents an SVG desc element. As with the SvgTextElement, the payload is in the enclosed text rather than in attributes and subelements, so we need to specially add text when serializing.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgElements.SvgDescElement
member.summary: Represents an SVG desc element. As with the SvgTextElement, the payload is in the enclosed text rather than in attributes and subelements, so we need to specially add text when serializing.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgException
member.summary: A general-purpose exception for problems that occur in SvgNet.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgException.Ctx
member.summary: A string intended to supply context information.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle
member.summary: Represents a CSS2 style, as applied to an SVG element.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new style, but does not do a deep copy on the members in the style. Thus if any of these are not strings, they meay be left referred to by more than one style or element.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.#ctor(System.Drawing.Pen)
member.summary: Creates a style from a GDI+ pen object. Most properties of the pen are implemented, but GDI+ allows fine control over line-capping which has no equivalent in SVG.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.#ctor(System.Drawing.SolidBrush)
member.summary: Creates a style based on a GDI brush object. Only works for solid brushes; pattern brushes are not yet emulated.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.#ctor(System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Creates a style based on a GDI+ font object. GDI+ allows many subtle specifications which have no SVG equivalent.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.Set(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a style. The key must be a string but the value can be anything (e.g. SvgColor). If and when the element that owns this style is written out to XML, ToString will be called on the value.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value for a given key.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a CSS string representation as used in SVG.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.ToString
member.summary: Outputs a CSS string representation as used in SVG.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.Keys
member.summary: A basic way to enumerate the styles.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.Item(System.String)
member.summary: A quick way to get and set style elements.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle.op_Addition(SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle,SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgStyle)
member.summary: Adds two SvgStyles together, resulting in a new object that contains all the attributes of both styles. Attributes are copied deeply, i.e. cloned if they are ICloneable.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgTransform
member.summary: Represents a single element in an SVG transformation list. The transformation is represented internally as a GDI+ Matrix object.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgTransform.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a transformation according to the SVG standard. This is complex enough that it makes me wish it was worth using a real parser, but antlr is so unwieldy.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgTransform.ToString
member.summary: Currently, we always output as matrix() no matter how the transform was specified.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgTransformList
member.summary: Represents an SVG transform-list, as specified in section 7.6 of the SVG 1.1 standard.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgTransformList.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a string containing a whitespace-separated list of transformations as per the SVG standard

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgAngleType
member.summary: The units in which an SvgAngle can be specified

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgLengthType
member.summary: The various units in which an SvgLength can be specified.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgPathSegType
member.summary: The various different types of segment that make up an SVG path, as listed in the SVG Path grammar.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.PathSeg
member.summary: A segment in an Svg path. This is not a real SVG type; it is not in the SVG spec. It is provided for making paths easier to specify and parse.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgAngle
member.summary: An angle, as found here and there throughout the SVG spec

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgColor
member.summary: A color, as found in CSS2 and used in SVG. As well as a GDI Color object, SvgColor stores the string it was initialized from, so that when a color specified as 'black' is written out, it will be written 'black' rather than '#000000'

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgColor.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: As well as parsing the four types of CSS color descriptor (rgb, #xxxxxx, color name, and system color name), the FromString of this type stores the original string

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgColor.ToString
member.summary: If the SvgColor was constructed from a string, use that string; otherwise use rgb() form

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgLength
member.summary: A length or coordinate component (in SVG 1.1 the specification says they are the same)

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgNumber
member.summary: A number, as specified in the SVG standard. It is stored as a float.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgNumber.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: float.Parse is used to parse the string. float.Parse does not follow the exact rules of the SVG spec.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgNumber.ToString
member.summary: float.ToString is used to output a string. This is true for all numbers in SvgNet.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgNumList
member.summary: A number list, as used in the SVG spec for e.g. the value of a viewBox attribute. Basically a list of numbers in any format separated by whitespace and commas.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgPath
member.summary: A path, composed of segments, as described in the SVG 1.1 spec section 8.3

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgPath.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: The parsing of the path is not completely perfect yet. You can only have one space between path elements.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgPoints
member.summary: A list of points, as specified in the SVG 1.1 spec section 9.8. Only used in polygon and polyline elements.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgPoints.#ctor(System.Single[])
member.summary: The array must have an even length

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgPoints.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: The standard boils down to a list of numbers in any format separated by any amount of wsp and commas; in other words it looks the same as a SvgNumList

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgUriReference
member.summary: Represents a URI reference within a style. Local uri references are generally strings of the form url(#elementID). This class should not be confused with which represents the xlink:* properties of, for example, an a element.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgTypes.SvgXRef
member.summary: Represents a URI reference. Unlike most svg types, uri references are represented by more than one attribute of an element. This means special measures are required to get and set uri references.

member.name: T:SvgNet.SvgStyledTransformedElement
member.summary: This is an SvgElement that can have a CSS style and an SVG transformation list. It contains special properties to make reading and setting the style and the transformation easier. All SVG elements that actually represent visual entities or groups of entities are SvgStyledTransformedElements.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgStyledTransformedElement.Style
member.summary: Provides an easy way to get the attribute called "style" as an SvgStyle object. If no such attribute has been set, one is created when this property is read.

member.name: P:SvgNet.SvgStyledTransformedElement.Transform
member.summary: Provides an easy way to get the attribute called "transform" as an SvgTransformList object. If no such attribute has been set, one is created when this property is read.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgStyledTransformedElement.ReadXmlElement(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Given a document and a current node, read this element from the node.

member.name: M:SvgNet.SvgStyledTransformedElement.WriteXmlElements(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Overridden in this class to provide special handling for the style and transform attributes, which are often long and complicated. For instance, it may be desirable for styles to be written as entities or as separate attributes.

member.name: T:SvgNet.TextNode
member.summary: Represents the text contained in a title, desc, text, or tspan element. Maps to an XmlText object in an XML document. It is inherited from

member.name: M:SvgNet.TextNode.AddChild(SvgNet.SvgElement)
member.summary: Adds a child, and sets the child's parent to this element.

member.name: M:SvgNet.TextNode.AddChildren(SvgNet.SvgElement[])
member.summary: Adds a variable number of children

member.name: M:SvgNet.TextNode.ReadXmlElement(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Given a document and a current node, read this element from the node.

member.name: M:SvgNet.TextNode.WriteXmlElements(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Overridden to simply create an XML text node below the parent.
